visualization_explanation: The dataset represents Earth's atmospheric structure through six categorical layers with proportional stacking. Each layer contains a single data point normalized to percentage composition through column stacking. Synthetic height ranges and scientific properties maintain domain validity through NASA atmospheric physics references. The hidden axes and percentage stacking emphasize relative positioning rather than quantitative scales. The stacked column format maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines and axis elements while maintaining Cairo's figure-ground relationship through graduated blue hues. Data labels provide direct annotation with layer altitudes, satisfying Tufte's principle of data-label integration. Uniform value distribution (μ=16.67%, σ=0 for each layer) creates equal visual weighting despite varying physical dimensions, emphasizing structural hierarchy over absolute metrics.
